sentences.english: The tea figure wearing justice tea for the turu to spare her home.
sentences.chinese: 戴天理給那圖倒茶敬茶求那圖魯饒了自己家。

sentences.english: Chinese people always offer their guests some tea.
On the second daytime, reception the rules bride and adore tea for the elders.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，按規矩新婦要給長輩們敬茶。

sentences.english: It's virtue of Chinese people to serve tea to guests.
sentences.chinese: 客來敬茶是中國人的美德。

definition: to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
first return of bride to her parental home
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
formal exchange of cups of wine between bride and groom as traditional wedding ceremony
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
to offer a cigarette (to a guest)
to pay one's respects/to give regards to
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
